org.apparatus_templi.xml

Class XmlFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.xml.XmlFormatter

  • public class XmlFormatter
extends Object
    A convenience class to handle generating XML data that conforms to the schema for full page XML and widget XML data. Contains a number of inner classes that can be used to represent sensors, controllers, and buttons.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson

      Initialize a new XmlFormatter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • XmlFormatter

        public XmlFormatter(Driver d,
            String longName)
        Initialize a new XmlFormatter.
        Parameters:
        d - a reference to the driver the data will represent.
        longName - a free-form String representing the name of this Driver.

    • Method Detail

      • setRefresh

        public XmlFormatter setRefresh(int refreshRate)
        Set the preferred refresh rate of this XML data. The frontends are free to ignore this value.
        Parameters:
        refreshRate - how often the frontend should refresh this data (in seconds).

      • clearElements

        public void clearElements()
        Removes all Elements.

      • addElement

        public void addElement(ElementInterface e)
        Adds an Element. Elements will be processed in the order in which they are added.
        Parameters:
        e - the Element to add.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • removeElement

        public void removeElement(ElementInterface e)
        Removes the first occurence of the given Element if it exists.
        Parameters:
        e - the Element to remove.

      • generateXml

        public String generateXml()
        Generate an XML representation of this button. This XML data generated is incomplete on its own, and is expected to be wrapped into a container by the XmlFormatter.
